comments.body: Everyone is going to get cert errors? no one will see this as being served from 127.0.0.1?

they're going to get cert errors anyway, since the cert is self-signed... using the same TLS cert as the httptest TLS server was expedient. I added CERT_FILE/KEY_FILE envvars so a different cert/key can be mounted in and used if desired

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +3,7 @@
The included localhost.crt is a PEM-encoded TLS cert with SAN IPs
"127.0.0.1" and "[::1]", expiring at the last second of 2049 (the end
of ASN.1 time), generated from src/crypto/tls:
go run generate_cert.go  --rsa-bits 512 --host 127.0.0.1,::1,example.com --ca --start-date "Jan 1 00:00:00 1970" --duration=1000000h
